It would be nice if more focus could be directed to the education, intervention, and assistance for adults with issues related to ACE (Adverse Chilldhood Experiences) you have the data and information on how problematic it is, however no mental health professionals in the area have heard about it with the exception of Charlotte Behavioral Health Care. The plan I've heard is more geared toward children, but they still have to coexist with adults who are seriously struggling with mental health issues attributed to ACE and they have no idea that anything is even wrong with them, let alone that help may be available. Most have been told they're no good or lazy their entire life. So they turn to drugs/crime etc to cope or they just kind of skate along trying to get by. It's tragic and sad. I don't know what the answer is, but would be willing to get involved to help educate the poor souls who really need it. ACE have life long consequences. Missing brain connections are no joke, and most if not all of these victims have not idea what's even wrong with them or that a diagnosis exists.
